column5: how is the fishing in Canada in September/October? Does anyone have a reccomendation for a good lake/lodge for Fall fishing?JOhnL

John; For many of us fighing doen't really get started until fall. There isn't a place I can think of where the fall isn't the best time to fish. Low boat traffic, reduced fishing pressure and the fish preparing for winter make it the best. The Kawartha lakes are great in October. Although a bit chilly, the musky fishing is great. Also on the great lakes the salmon move closer to shore and fatten up for the spawn.
Fall fishing. Pine falls manitoba huge walleye's.and the lake trout go shallow great fishing can hardly wait.FISH ON.
Try Rainy Lake -great fall fishing -have a 3 bedroom cabin for rent [email protected]

If you like smallies, colchester ontario, on the westren basin of lake eire. It's normal to get 100 fish from 3-6#.Some say the next recod smallie, may come from that area. good luck bring lots of livebait.

Yep. Spectacular fishing for Walleye at Pine Falls in the fall. You have a very good chance at fish over 30". No lakers here though ... although they are found nearby in Northwest Ontario and points further north in Manitoba
You might try Last Mountain lake in Saskatchewan. Incredible trophy fishing for walleye up to 14 pounds.If you would like more inof, e-mail me @[email protected]Pikeman
IF YOUR INTO MUSKIE PIGEON LAKE IS HARD TO BEAT!LOTS OF FISH AND SOME BIG ONES AS WELL. LAST YEAR WAS EXCELLENT.
